newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mid-Atlantic spot power up on warmer weather.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mid-Atlantic spot power up on warmer weather.

text.p: Spot wholesale electricity prices in the U.S. Mid-Atlantic rose Friday on outlook of warmer weather moving into the region bolstering power demand next week, market sources said.
"The load is expected up slightly," said a Northeast-based trader.

Latest forecasts indicated the Mid-Atlantic would enjoy peak temperatures in the 60s to 70s Fahrenheit Saturday, and the region would experience seasonal to above-normal autumn temperatures all next week.
Some participants attributed today's rise to marketers who were short-covering their October positions in the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) Interconnect pool.
Transmission contraint was again heard in the Philadelphia control area where a major substation continued to operate at reduced operation after an oil fire two weeks ago.
"People have to schedule around it. They may have to increase generation to move power into that area," another PJM trader said.
Firm, peak PJM electricity for Monday delivery was quoted at $21.50-$22.50 a megawatt hour (MWh), up from Thursday's range of than $20.25-$21.50.
Firm, off-peak power for Monday's light load hours in PJM was notationally assessed at $13.00-$14.00, a wider quote than Thursday's $13.00-$13.50.
For the rest of October, PJM electricity for firm, peak delivery was pegged near $21.25-$22.25, compared with a $21.00 quote on Thursday.
November PJM electricity for firm, peak delivery was assessed at $23.00-$23.35, up from Thursday's $22.60-$22.90. A November deal was heard done at $23.10.
December PJM power with similar delivery conditions was discussed between $28.00-$28.25, up from a Thursday range of $27.65-$27.90. A December transaction reportedly changed hands at $28.10.
January/February 1997 PJM deliveries were pegged at $32.00-$32.25, up from Thursday's $31.75-$32.00 quote. Deals were heard transacted between $31.75 and $32.05.
First-quarter 1997 PJM electricity was valued at $29.50-$29.60, flat from Thursday.
Second-quarter 1997 power prices in PJM was again quoted at near $22.00.
July/August 1997 PJM deliveries were at $31.50-$32.50, up from Thursday's range of $31.00-$32.00.
